db:abstract.db:para: The <QtMath> header file provides various math functions.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: These functions are partly convenience definitions for basic math operations not available in the C or Standard Template Libraries.
The header also ensures some constants specified in POSIX, but not present in C++ standards (so absent from <math.h> on some platforms), are defined:

db:td.db:para: The base of the natural logarithms, e = exp(1)
The ratio of a circle's circumference to diameter, π
Twice the inverse of M_PI, 2 / π
Two divided by the square root of pi, 2 / √π

db:section.db:title: auto qAcos(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the arccosine of v as an angle in radians. Arccosine is the inverse operation of cosine.

db:section.db:title: auto qAsin(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the arcsine of v as an angle in radians. Arcsine is the inverse operation of sine.

db:section.db:title: auto qAtan2(T1 y, T2 x)
db:section.db:para: Returns the arctangent of a point specified by the coordinates y and x. This function will return the angle (argument) of that point.

db:section.db:title: auto qAtan(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the arctangent of v as an angle in radians. Arctangent is the inverse operation of tangent.

db:section.db:title: int qCeil(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the ceiling of the value v.
The ceiling is the smallest integer that is not less than v. For example, if v is 41.2, then the ceiling is 42.

db:section.db:title: auto qCos(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the cosine of an angle v in radians.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] double qDegreesToRadians(double degrees)
db:section.db:para: This function converts the degrees in double to radians.
Example:

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] float qDegreesToRadians(float degrees)
db:section.db:para: This function converts the degrees in float to radians.
Example:

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.0] long double qDegreesToRadians(long double degrees)
db:section.db:para: This function converts the degrees in double to radians.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: auto qExp(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the exponential function of e to the power of v.

db:section.db:title: auto qFabs(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the absolute value of v.

db:section.db:title: int qFloor(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the floor of the value v.
The floor is the largest integer that is not greater than v. For example, if v is 41.2, then the floor is 41.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.1] auto qHypot(F first, Fs... rest)
db:section.db:para: Returns the distance from origin in arbitrarily many dimensions

This is as for the two-argument and three-argument forms, supported by std::hypot(), but with as many numeric parameters as you care to pass to it. Uses first and each of the rest as coordinates, performing a calculation equivalent to squaring each, summing and returning the square root, save that underflow and overflow are avoided as far as possible.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.1] auto qHypot(Tx x, Ty y)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the distance of a point (x, y) from the origin (0, 0).
This is qSqrt(x * x + y * y), optimized. In particular, underflow and overflow may be avoided.
Accepts any mix of numeric types, returning the same floating-point type as std::hypot(). If either parameter is infinite, so is the result; otherwise, if either is a NaN, so is the result.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.1] auto qHypot(Tx x, Ty y, Tz z)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the distance of a point (x, y, z) from the origin (0, 0, 0).
This is qSqrt(x * x + y * y + z * z), optimized where supported. In particular, underflow and overflow may be avoided.
Accepts any mix of numeric types, returning the same floating-point type as std::hypot(). If any parameter is infinite, so is the result; otherwise, if any is NaN, so is the result.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: auto qLn(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the natural logarithm of v. Natural logarithm uses base e.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] quint32 qNextPowerOfTwo(quint32 value)
db:section.db:para: This function returns the nearest power of two greater than value. For 0 it returns 1, and for values larger than or equal to 2^31 the result is undefined.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] quint32 qNextPowerOfTwo(qint32 value)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
This function returns the nearest power of two greater than value. For negative values the result is undefined.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] quint64 qNextPowerOfTwo(qint64 value)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
This function returns the nearest power of two greater than value. For negative values the result is undefined.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] quint64 qNextPowerOfTwo(quint64 value)
db:section.db:para: This function returns the nearest power of two greater than value. For 0 it returns 1, and for values larger than or equal to 2^63 the result is undefined.

db:section.db:title: auto qPow(T1 x, T2 y)
db:section.db:para: Returns the value of x raised to the power of y. That is, x is the base and y is the exponent.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] double qRadiansToDegrees(double radians)
db:section.db:para: This function converts the radians in double to degrees.
Example:
db:section.db:programlisting: double radians = M_PI double degrees = qRadiansToDegrees(radians)

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] float qRadiansToDegrees(float radians)
db:section.db:para: This function converts the radians in float to degrees.
Example:
db:section.db:programlisting: float radians = float(M_PI) float degrees = qRadiansToDegrees(radians)

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.0] long double qRadiansToDegrees(long double radians)
db:section.db:para: This function converts the radians in double to degrees.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: auto qSin(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the sine of the angle v in radians.

db:section.db:title: auto qSqrt(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the square root of v. This function returns a NaN if v is a negative number.

db:section.db:title: auto qTan(T v)
db:section.db:para: Returns the tangent of an angle v in radians.
